title: How to achieve this style
content:
Just want to know how to achieve this style of hand writing. Is this done with a chisel texter or a paint brush?

[http://designspiration.net/image/864492140743/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202229/http:/designspiration.net/image/864492140743/ "http://designspiration.net/image/864492140743/")  
 [http://designspiration.net/image/601687944884/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202229/http:/designspiration.net/image/601687944884/ "http://designspiration.net/image/601687944884/")

And any ideas where I can get some books/tutorials for this kind of lettering technique?

Cheers
author: purzeki

comments.content:
Maybe ask on a forum about handwriting/lettering.

hhp

Do you mean on here? I thought I was in the handwriting section.

Unless you mean to find another forum specifically for that.

Cheers,

P

Since this site is about _fonts_ (even the "handwriting" section) I'm assuming there are better sites for this question. But maybe you'll get lucky here!

hhp

I would say that is called _lettering_. Maybe posting on the General Discussions forum a question about resources for lettering would give some result. Typophile [Charles Borges de Oliveira](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202229/http:/typophile.com/node/31391) [http://www.borgeslettering.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202229/http:/www.borgeslettering.com/ "http://www.borgeslettering.com/") does some lettering. I don't think he is the only typophile to do that. By the way, Cabarga's book, [Logo, Font & Lettering Bible](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202229/http:/www.amazon.com/Logo-Lettering-Bible-Leslie-Cabarga/dp/1581804369) used to be a reference here on typophile.

Here is a typophile thread that may lead to something helpful: [http://typophile.com/node/98612](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317202229/http:/typophile.com/node/98612 "http://typophile.com/node/98612")
